title: can you import a Mac profile folder into a PC version of Thunderbird?
content: OK, this is really complicated, and involves trying to rescue an old Eudora account to Thunderbird. If anyone wants the whole gory story, please ask and I'll tell all. ( I used Eudora Mailbox Cleaner and Eudora Rescue.) But the simple question is: is it possible to import a Thunderbird profile created on a Mac into a Thunderbird program on a PC? Thanks for any help.
creator: mamaconnie

title: Spam or junk folder
content:
I no longer receive emails from a company I do business with. I previously received all of their emails but none in the past several months. They have not made any changes so it must be a Thunderbird issue. I was told to check my spam/junk folder but I can't find in Thunderbird. Can you help?

Thanks, Danny Monts
creator: montsco

title: Settings in transition from iinnet to themessaging.co
content: In trying to fix settings I have created 2 new account + the original, all with the same name. The system continually tries unsuccessfully then blocks me for too many attempts. 1. how do I delete the two new accounts, one IMAP and one Pop, without deleting the original much used account? 2. How do I change the settings on the old account so it connects through the messaging.co now iinet no longer runs it? It should be IMAP not pop. My attempts so far have just created new accounts and more problems.
creator: rkpwor

title: 'Number of recipients' counter?
content: While sending messages to multiple recipients not listed in an address list, I do miss this feature - ie one that upon a click shows the number of recipients. You know, If we know our daily sending allowance courtesy of the provider, then such a feature would allow us to work more efficiently.
creator: don.mitchel

title: Email disappears on printing
content: I printed an email from Thunderbird before responding to it. When I went to reply, it had disappeared from the Inbox. After some hunting I found it in the All Mail folder, but it refused to be moved or copied to the Inbox. Even when I forwarded it to myself it did not appear in the Inbox. The message was still present on the Gmail server but Thunderbird would not download it via Imap. Have I missed a setting or does Thunderbird consider an email to be deleted once it is printed?
creator: frank3ifl
